It is characterized by its distinctive flat, petal-like structures that resemble leaves, which is a notable botanical feature. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in dense forests. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a unique arrangement that sets it apart from other members of the Zosterophyllaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
